div.p: STILLINGIA, in botany ; a genus oſ plants belonging to the claſs of monaecia, and to the order of mοnοdelphia. The male calyx is hemiſpherical and multiflorous. The corolla is tubulous, and eroſe or gnawed. The female calyx is uniflorous and inferior. The corolla is ſuperior. The ſtyle is trifid, and the capſule three-grained. There is only one ſpecies, the ſylvatica.
